Frame:War

From EN MetaNet Wiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Name Gloss War
Transcription
Description
Closest FrameNet Frame(s) Hostile_encounter
Maps to IARPA Source Concept(s)
Other aliases
Comments The Hostile_encounter FN frame describes a hostile encounter between two opposing forces.

Eve: I added side1 and side2. Eventually this has to be overhauled, so that there is a NONVIEWPOINTED War frame as well as a viewpointed one that is Invaded good guys vs. Invader bad guys. But side1 and side2 are being linked to Competition.competitors. ALSO War should have an x-schema that can be mapped onto the Competition x-schema, and winner and loser roles that map onto the winner and loser roles in the Competition frame, and an Outcome that maps onto Outcome in Competition, and...

Elise: now that the Competition frames are revamped, this needs to be overhauled as well.

Family Physical conflict frames, Competition frames, Physical combat frame family
Tags
Type Frame, Composed
Cultural Scope American English, Mexican Spanish
Cultural Information This frame captures organized wars fought by armies under hierarchical leadership with the use of weapons and strategies over territory.

checked cultural scope for English and Spanish - Karie July 8 2014

Bindings:

Inferences

Description The army engages in fighting against enemy_combatants on the battlefield using weapons in the context of a war_strategy devised by generals seeking to minimize enemy_conquest and achieve victory as quickly as possible.
Type
Description The fighting occurs in response to an enemy_attack on a battlefield in which usually some amount of enemy_conquest has occurred.
Type

Metaphor Program Alias

Metaphors that use this frame:

as Target frame as Source frame
  • ADDRESSING GUN VIOLENCE IS WAGING WAR
  • ADDRESSING SOCIAL PROBLEMS IS WAGING WAR
  • ARGUMENT IS WAR
  • CANCER TREATMENT IS WAR
  • DIPLOMACY IS WAR
  • DISEASE TREATMENT IS WAR
  • ELECTION IS WAR
  • LOSING AN ELECTION IS LOSING A WAR
  • WINNING AN ELECTION IS WINNING A WAR

The Hostile_encounter FN frame describes a hostile encounter between two opposing forces.

Eve: I added side1 and side2. Eventually this has to be overhauled, so that there is a NONVIEWPOINTED War frame as well as a viewpointed one that is Invaded good guys vs. Invader bad guys. But side1 and side2 are being linked to Competition.competitors. ALSO War should have an x-schema that can be mapped onto the Competition x-schema, and winner and loser roles that map onto the winner and loser roles in the Competition frame, and an Outcome that maps onto Outcome in Competition, and...

Elise: now that the Competition frames are revamped, this needs to be overhauled as well.
